As a language model AI, I don't have personal opinions, but I can suggest some ways traditional taxi companies can keep up with the competition from ride-sharing services:

1. Improve the customer experience: Traditional taxi companies can improve their customer experience by offering better-quality vehicles, friendlier and knowledgeable drivers, and a more convenient payment system.

2. Develop a mobile app: They can develop a mobile application that allows passengers to book and track their cabs, rate drivers, and provide feedback.

3. Offer competitive pricing: Traditional taxi companies can offer competitive pricing by eliminating hidden costs, offering discounts for frequent riders, and using dynamic pricing models like ride-sharing services.

4. Improve dispatch efficiency: Efficient dispatching plays a critical role in providing excellent service. They can use advanced dispatch technology to reduce wait time for customers and provide real-time feedback to drivers.

5. Collaborate with ride-sharing services: Taxi companies can collaborate with ride-sharing services to attract more customers, which will increase their market share and revenue.

6. Implement digital marketing: Digital marketing can help traditional taxi companies reach a broader audience and promote their services through various social media and search engine optimization platforms.

Investing in new technology and improving customer experience can help traditional taxi companies compete with ride-sharing services effectively.
